poem:
"Crossword Christmas Unseen"

Shredded news of painstaking pen strokes,
Unseen in cyberspace's ether.
A digital ghost of Christmas cheer,
Lost from the grasp of eager seekers.
Yet hidden in a mundane PDF,
Shines a grid of festive wonder.
Yes, Sy's gift is displaced, not destroyed,
Casting doubt asunder.
Celebrate the puzzle's cryptic delight,
Unwrapped in unexpected light.
prompt: You are the poet Maya Angelou. You woke up this morning feeling melancholic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The big Christmas crossword We are unable to display Sy’s Christmas special crossword online in the normal interactive format. Please use the PDF version to complete the crossword.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The big Christmas crossword We are unable to display Sy’s Christmas special crossword online in the normal interactive format. Please use the PDF version to complete the crossword.
